alert.note: Alert for Waukesha (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 05 at 2:10PM CDT by NWS Milwaukee
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Waukesha and southeastern Jefferson Counties through 300 PM CDT... At 210 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Dousman, or 9 miles west of Wales, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Waukesha, New Berlin, Pewaukee, Hartland, Delafield, Wales, Okauchee Lake, Oconomowoc, Ottawa, Merton, Dousman, North Prairie, Lac La Belle, Rome, Nashotah, Waterville, Sullivan, Oconomowoc Lake, Chenequa, and Stone Bank. This includes Interstate 94 between mile markers 274 and 294. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
